reviews.text: This is the best museum in Banff! It has great taxidermy and the building is something special. You can get in free if you are an annual pass holder, just remember to bring the pass with you, and you might be required to return it to your car because they don't want a picture of the back with your signature and not having a pass in your car opens you up for a park ticket. It's an awful system but the museum is well with a visit.

This should be free with park passes, it's got some really cool stuff like old laps of Canada before the provinces were shaped the way they are now. It's basically a taxidermy display with all the animals you might see in Banff.

Great historical landmark. The staff were so nice and willing to tell us so much detail about the museum. I didn't understand it at first but once you ask questions, it's honestly quite an interesting place!

This is one of the oldest natural museums built in 1903. It served as the best example of surviving rustic architectural design found in early 1900. This is an iconic cultural collection for over 115 years! 

The garden is also a great photo site for a wedding. 

One of the must-go sightseeing point in Banff, Alberta
Very nice museum. Allison was working and was very nice and informative.  Was very cool to see all the native animals in our country/Rockies. Recommend going to check out.
People can enjoy Banff beautiful scenery while hiking on the Bow Falls trail. It is an easy hike, even for the people who have no hiking experience

Bow falls and Bow falls trail should be on your to do list when you visit Banff, regardless of the season. The trail is gentle, but all along the river with many scenic spots. Also go down from the falls a bit for an amazing view of the snow capped mountains. It is lovely that raging falls become a gentle stream so quickly.
Totally beautiful view and something really to enjoy. I can't say enough but just absorb as much as you can when you are here.

Bow Falls is a pretty waterfall along the Bow River and is a short walk from Banff, making it a convenient spot to visit. 

The wide trail through the forest started from across the bridge at the south end of town and followed along the Bow River with pretty views of the mountains and river along the way. It was a flat, easy and peaceful 10-minute walk from Banff. 

The small waterfall spanned the width across the river and was a low cascade. There were great photo opportunities and lovely views of the surrounding scenery. I would recommend a relaxing walk here when in Banff!
A family favourite

Would like to see a change in dogs procedure on your property it is so beautiful and  welcoming ...But....... I don't want to leave my dog at home or in the car he needs exercise as much as you I....I promise to clean up after a accident and as always on a leash ...thank you for thinking of this idea a little more...

Although the garden is currently a collection of dirt and stone, during the summer it is quite the sight to see. This is also the location where many Banff photos that surface on Reddit are taken, because it is directly center of the road to the town, with the beautiful mountain in the backdrop. It is free to enter and walk around.

Great place to visit during Spring/Summer. Beautiful garden with the background of rocky mountains, lots of flowers! The perfect place to take nice family pictures and enjoy the view. A must-see in Banff for sure. Will come back when the Winter is gone ;)
Love the old feel of the building, looking forward to seeing the garden in summer.
The gardens themselves are very picturesque but perhaps a greater attraction is the signature photo opportunity looking down the main street.
Very nice Lake with lots of parking. Low light views are absolutely gorgeous. Watch out for a lot of wild life in the area

It's a lake. It's cold. There's canoe rental in the summer, and ice fishing in the winter, I think? The hiking trail along the north shore is beautiful, and fairly easy. It's bear country, so bring spray and travel in groups!

We took the boat cruise on this lake.  Tour guides were very nice.  The boat we were on was well maintained.  Due to forest fires in BC, the lake was surrounded by smoke and visibility was very low.  There were hiking trails along the lake.  Parking can be a challenge at busy seasons.  Washrooms were clean.  There was a small shop that you can buy ice creams and coffees.
A memorable place my husband and I visited in September 2014, when there was still snow om the trees. Unforgetable 😍.
Lovely lake to visit. We had an enjoyable bus ride from Banff. Unfortunately only had a short time at the lake, but it was worth the trip.

Parking will be your biggest problem here but aside from that when we come to banff we almost always come explore this area. You have to be a little adventurous to see the good stuff but you can get down to the river and see the falls from another side.
Lovely, even managed to catch a train going by. This is a very popular spot for landscape photographers and even trainspotters. Definitely was gorgeous in the winter.
A tiny corner that most people miss. You get an awesome view of the major hotels in the other side and get away from the hustle of Banff.
Magnificent view of Fairmont Banff Spring taken from Surprise Corner in December 2018
Great view. Would love to go back
Love going here whenever I visit. So informative and interesting. Lovely staff. I like their online store as well. I just wish everything on there was available to buy, not just certain pieces.  😊
Both the art gallery and the heritage displays were excellent. The "women of the Rockies" display was my favourite. The gift shop had a great book selection.

This is an interesting museum, that will give you the opportunity of enjoy and relate much more to Canada. Exhibitions are about people, culture, wildlife, history, etc. Tools, clothing, animals, housing and much more. Worthwhile visiting!
Less than I was expecting. It has a great archive for research however.
I thought it had a superb mix of multimedia and traditional exhibits. The Library and Photo Archive was tucked away but well worth spending some time going through the many albums.
Would be nice if it was cheaper - not sure if it's a high rent thing or they can just get away with it because: Banff. Still we go maybe a few times a year - or more often when to busy to cook!

3.5

Food is good, but nothing to write home about.

It is a cheaper place to eat compared to other locations. It is a very small location however, so it does fill up fast.
Cozy and neat. I was told it is real Japanese taste.
Good food with generous portions. Cozy and small setting. Busy place but they have a great system of managing tables and waitlist. Friendly staff.
Delicious fresh hot food, perfect for winter. Very nice staffs as well just wish there's more seats

Rarely give 5 star reviews, but after 5 years away from Banff this place is still the hidden gem I remember. Tom yum second to none, prices are possibly the best value you will find in Banff. Traveled from Toronto with my gf who lived with me in Banff five years ago, and the first place we needed to go for dinner, we agreed, was pad Thai restaurant. So glad we made the trip back, and foods as great as we remembered! Wishing only success and plenty years of delicious food service ahead.
Delicious food! Wonderful service and prices that match the portions.
The food is really good and the staff is friendly.
Delicious Thai Green Curry, great prices, highly recommended
I was here Dec. 2017 so it might have changed since then. My visit was very pleasant and the food was very good! I has rice noodle coconut soup and it was so good!

This is our main store for shopping close to home! It can be pretty spendy at times with prices, but with Just4U coupons help a lot!! They have some great deals at times. If you want quality and a variety even with Safeway brands  Safeway is great for that. They have a deli, bakery and pharmacy. They also have a Starbucks inside. The one complaint I have lately with them is their meat department. The quality of their meat isn't as great as it use to be. We've found bone grit on the pork and bones in boneless skinless chicken. Otherwise I love their produce, breads, desserts and products!! Plus you'll always get GREAT customer service and asked if you need help out!! Or you can also do self checkout instead.

All and all it's not a bad place to shop... it's a little spendy... you definitely need to watch for deals... The cashiers are pretty nice..The pharmacy and their employees are Rock Stars... Trevor is one of the pharmacist who always goes above and beyond to take care of your needs... Thank you ever so much Trevor... yes, Amy your pretty awesome... Thank you kindly... :-) :-) :-)

This store is brightly lit and well maintained. We usually go to Costco for a lot of reasons but for small and unique grocery purchases we end up at Safeway. The checkers at this location are almost always pleasant and attentive, both things that aren't always guaranteed these days.
Its a grocery store chain. The quality is good. The price is a little high, but they offer a membership discount.

The old lady in the deli is absolutely the rudest person I’ve ever met in my life she constantly makes you feel like your bothering her that you want a sandwhich rolled her eyes and got huffy puffy that I asked for bacon and proceeded to say “I guess, but that’s gonna cost more” (like I didn’t already know that) then didn’t ask me if I wanted anything else threw my snadwhich on the counter and walked away. I will never be going back there again so disappointed

The best Flat White I had in Banff. A great spot to pull up a chair and hang out for a while. The food all looked amazing, the chocolate croissant had seemingly infinite layers and had that perfectly risen flavour. Can't say enough good things, be sure to check it out if you're around the town or just want to grab some bread to take home.

Nice little coffee shop and bakery with great variety. I enjoyed my machiato. I wouldn't recommend the banana chocolate muffins -- tasted a little too strongly of baking soda. Otherwise a great little spot.
Great coffee and $1 refills!  We stayed here for a while reading and coffee drinking. Good times!  Food looked good but we didn’t have any.
Nice! Exceptional latte, says my guest.   Vegan veggie sandwich, could be better with a sauce. Wonderful breads :)

It has a nice atmosphere. Coffee was good and they have a great selection of baked goods. Looks like this place can get quite busy. My friend and I arrived here at 8am on a Monday morning and there was 1 person in there. 5 minutes later it seemed to get completely full.

We were at the place during a girl's night out. Food was so freaking delicious. Its worth to make a trip from Calgary just to eat this goodness. So fresh and so authentic. Top notch guest services. Thank you for a wonderful experience.

We love their food! I hadn’t had bulldog for lonnnng time, but it’s the best one I have ever had! (Usually I’m a beer person) Guacamole was super tasty, and the burrito was...awesome🥰
Fast service, even though it was a Friday night, drink and food came very smoothly. Good atmosphere, strongly recommend you to go for their special! (Half price wing night as well)

I gotta eat a gluten free diet. I informed the server and she ride away took good care of me. She informed me her father suffers from the same problem. She explained the menu and I gotta say the food was bomb. Kids loved it as well. Good job!

Great little place for "Mexican" food. The atmosphere is eclectic and fun. The nachos were very good, the tacos were so so, a little under seasoned and over sauced. The chicken taco with mole sauce was good. I would recommend going here if you are in town.

This place was awesome!! Bartenders were wicked. Cheap margaritas on Thursday. Tons of tequila options to choose from lots of spicy drinks, good tacos, nice atmosphere. Just A1 all around. You guys are deadly.

I was a little skeptical about dining here, but it is hands down the best food experience I've ever had. From the amazing cocktails, to the amuse bouche, dinner and desert, it was nothing short of spectacular. You read the ingredients going into the dishes and think the chef is crazy, then you taste it and realize he is a genius! Well worth every penny and recommend to anyone wanting an amazing food experience.

Nothing short of spectacular. Our dinning experience was amazing from the start. Our Server was excellent, the food...the food was AMAZING. We love to dine out and treat ourselves to a fancier meal once in a while, and this was worth every penny! The decor was subtle, but the food colourful, well thought out and presented beautifully. If I could kiss the chef, I would. This restaurant is a go to for sure.
Great food and great service ! The food is really fine dining and presented beautifully. The flavours are complex and unexpected in a really good way. Overall this is a place worth trying !
A hidden gem. Enjoyed one of the best meals I've ever had here. Staff are friendly, the food is amazing and the views are breathtaking. Reasonably priced too! A must visit, but don't tell everyone!

The food was just okay, in my opinion.  It was not bad but definitely did not live up to the hype.  I thought the Chef tried to incorporate too many flavors into one dish.  My wife and I try to have at least one fine dining experience while on vacation and wish we would have chosen differently.

A must stop for the best French Onion Soup I've ever had!  The pork buttons & beef wellingtons appetizers were also right up at the top! The Classic Ceasar was the best we had in town complete with a pickled green bean! Our waiter was amazing, informative & helpful not only about the restaurant but the town as well. This is the oldest restaurant in Banff & well worth a visit!

Just had our fourth meal here during our 2 week stay.  Excellent place. So relaxing and the staff are brilliant. I only suggest that you increase the pool tables by another 1 or 2. Plenty of room. When we visit in the summer we will come back through. Thanks for our meals .
From what I remember a really fun bar! The cod was delicious

Where to start this little dive has to be my favorite place delicious food great staff good music! 
Overall a great time!
Especially on $4 beer night ;)
Got to see my favourite bands here! Not the best if you are short and it’s a full house, but people are always nice, drinks and staff are great!

This place is absolutely amazing! The staff is wonderful and the atmosphere is great. Oh and the food is excellent! The best part about this place are the phones at every table. You can call tables around and have a little conversation with whomever picks up! I will definitely be back.

I love the look out and inside. Very comfortable such dim lighting and unique art, made it worth the experience alone... Tried shark and kangaroo for the first time on a hot rock. I enjoyed everything! The cheese fondue is going to bring me back! 10/10 would recommend.

Such a unique spot and a timeless mainstay in Banff. Been meaning to try for years and finally got the chance to. 

I’m an adventurous eater so I tried the exotic meats platter. Frog legs were my favourite, followed by Kangaroo and snake. I didn’t like the shark one bit though. 

Get the chocolate fondue.

Loved our experience at the Grizzly House! The food - amazing! The staff - amazing! The ambiance - amazing! Such a unique place and experience I will never forget! Shout out to our waitress, Megan, she was awesome!

Great place to eat! On a classical Banff restaurant. The food is great! And out a very fun and different place. Each table has a phone and you can call all the tables bad chat with the people in the restaurant! I loved it

The Keg is always fairly reliable. Our server Maddy was really great, very helpful and knowledgable and the perfect level of chatty! Friendly enough to engage us but didn’t hover. She was awesome. Food was consistent but not outstanding.

I have to agree with others over priced and took forever. Hour and 45 min is ridiculous. Then the steak looked like it was cooked with a blow torch when it got there. I mean it was burnt to a crisp. Sent it back and watched my daughter eat hers. The manager had better have talk with the kitchen what were they thinking sending out a 50.00 dollar steak like that. They offered to make it right but only a fool would eat anything after it's been sent back to the kitchen. Heading to the pizza place next door.

Upon first glance the atmosphere was incredibly welcoming however are server was on the questionable end of things. 
   
 Originally my husband had ordered a strip sirloin steak and I ordered a baseball cut. 
  The server at first came  across rather over-bearing and then proceeded to continue to do so after the arrival of the meal. 
  My husband immediately noticed that his food was not correct and pointed it out to the server in which she proceeded to deny the mistake. Claiming that after years of service she was not capable of making a mistake she wouldn’t have been aware of. 
 Thankfully the manager came by through our meal to check on things and after finding out the meal was wrong, offered a free desert
 -(which we happily accepted) 

 Over-all 4/5 rating because the manager was so welcoming and professional!  
 I will happily return again and looking at the photos makes me hopeful to do so very soon! -(scrumptious, and the husband agreed despite the mistake)
What a fabulous location and dinner! Our server was amazing, we can't remember her name but she's been there for 12 years!! Thanks again!
Food was good, came out hot and fast. Our server was friendly and knowledgeable about the menu. All around a great dinner.

The Keg is always fairly reliable. Our server Maddy was really great, very helpful and knowledgable and the perfect level of chatty! Friendly enough to engage us but didn’t hover. She was awesome. Food was consistent but not outstanding.

I have to agree with others over priced and took forever. Hour and 45 min is ridiculous. Then the steak looked like it was cooked with a blow torch when it got there. I mean it was burnt to a crisp. Sent it back and watched my daughter eat hers. The manager had better have talk with the kitchen what were they thinking sending out a 50.00 dollar steak like that. They offered to make it right but only a fool would eat anything after it's been sent back to the kitchen. Heading to the pizza place next door.

Upon first glance the atmosphere was incredibly welcoming however are server was on the questionable end of things. 
   
 Originally my husband had ordered a strip sirloin steak and I ordered a baseball cut. 
  The server at first came  across rather over-bearing and then proceeded to continue to do so after the arrival of the meal. 
  My husband immediately noticed that his food was not correct and pointed it out to the server in which she proceeded to deny the mistake. Claiming that after years of service she was not capable of making a mistake she wouldn’t have been aware of. 
 Thankfully the manager came by through our meal to check on things and after finding out the meal was wrong, offered a free desert
 -(which we happily accepted) 

 Over-all 4/5 rating because the manager was so welcoming and professional!  
 I will happily return again and looking at the photos makes me hopeful to do so very soon! -(scrumptious, and the husband agreed despite the mistake)
What a fabulous location and dinner! Our server was amazing, we can't remember her name but she's been there for 12 years!! Thanks again!
Food was good, came out hot and fast. Our server was friendly and knowledgeable about the menu. All around a great dinner.

I recently visited the Saltlik together with my son. We were looking for nice steaks. And we found them there. Very yummy, cooked to perfection. And the service was great as well. I would give 5 stars if they would not have had that strange DJ who played that awful music.

We had a fantastic, unexpected experience at Saltlik. We got here at 9pm when happy hour was starting, and the prices/menu for happy hour was so good! We sat downstairs in the lounge.  I had the steak sandwich, was perfect!  Good drinks at a great price. 
Would defenitly recommend and go back for sure!

We sat at the bar downstairs which was lively but not too loud.  The young bartender was very friendly, nice to chat with, and provided great service.  Good selection of beers at a decent price.  we had the nachos, which I would give a solid 5 out of 10, ya, not very good.  The chips they use were really good but they put very little cheese or toppings on top and they cover it with a pretty spicy hot sauce, rather than on the side, which could be a little overwhelming for the less spicy taste buds.

This is an amazing steakhouse. I was with a group and the service was great; our waiter, Winchester, took awesome care of us and made suggestions for ordering our steaks and pairing them with wine. The food was delicious. We had a wonderful time treating ourselves and will definitely be back.

Hanger steak at the bar is incredible. Tip to the manager: don't let you staff sit at the bar and get drunk when they're not working. It's a turnoff and I had to relocate due to noise after the 7pm tequila shots came out.

This is a decent fine dining restaurant, but for the money, the flavours didn’t hit the spot. The plates and food looks beautiful - like works of art - but I found the flavours didn’t match up to the presentation. The service was excellent though ! The waiters are attentive and really professional. Overall it’s a decent experience but the prices for the food don’t necessarily align.

Fantastic service from the moment we arrived until the moment we left. The food was incredible, and the bar selection was great as well. Highlights included the Double Smoked Manhattan, the Lobster from the 9-course meal, and dessert!
Without a doubt the best food I have ever had. I'm not one to go out of my comfort zone but at Eden everything was so delicious. Great service, beautiful restaurant and amazing food.

Absolutely worth the money! Our group of four tried the four part tasting menu. The service was outstanding. I really enjoyed all of the cheese options. I recommend getting the pork ribs for an entree and blueberry dark chocolate for dessert. My whole table agreed these tasted best. Be sure to ask for a table near the windows with the best mountain view-- I wish we had done this.
Nice breakfast nice place to see with  good views
Lovely chocolate. Good service
Terribly slow service. Waited 15 mins to buy some chocolate.
This is a small store and it seems to not carry the full line of chocolates. However it is very excellent chocolate.
We always have to go to Cows when in Banff. We first went to the PEI location. We were so excited to find Cows in Banff so many years ago. We still have that excitement today.
Delicious, smooth, and creamy hard ice cream! Stop in for a scoop or 2, you won't regret it!
Delicious, long line up, but it moved quickly and well worth the 10 minute wait.

Whenever I go to banff and I'm craving something sweet, I always make sure to stop by my favourite ice cream store for some delicious treats! The ice cream is so good and there's so many flavours to choose from! You can also get a triple scoop option which us great if you have a sweet tooth like me! It's also an affordable option
I have been to Cows in PEI like 30 years ago. Very cool, super nice guys and we loved our icecream.
Sinful delights in fudge and sweet things. Everything is just delicious.
My favorite place ever! You gotta try their bear paws. It is a bit pricy but worth every penny.

The fudgery is a great stop whenever you're in the pile place market in Seattle. They have a ton of sweet stuff as you can probably imagine, and fudge in every flavour! You can also see how they make the fudge in house as they make it fresh every day, as well as simple any of the flavours that you want! Perfect for a sweet munch or to take home as a souvenir

I have a sweet tooth. All sweets and chocolate.  If you even remotely have a sweet tooth you have to stop in here.  My personal favourites include the vanilla coconut clusters, milk chocolate salted caramel  bars and the bear claws... but it’s all good.  The fudge is always fresh and delicious.  The only thing I’ve never gone for is the ice cream at the back but that’s only because all the other stuff is so good.

Delicious fudge made right there infront pf you! Best fudgr I have ever had I actually have to go there every time I go to Banff. There are a lot of flavours and the best part about this experience is that you get to watch how theu pour and cut it on a big marble slab.
Really cool shop with lots of candy to pick from. Some of it you probably have never even heard of before! It also has cool exotic sodas and nice service. Keep up the great work guys!
Good selection of candy  staff very helpful and polite.  Definately recommended.  Plus good selection of salt water taffy.
This has become a tradition for our family for over 20 years to stop in and get a treat. I loved the place way back then and my kids love it now! Truly an institution in Banff.
Super expensive. 5 bucks for a handful of jelly beans??? I also expected a more unique selection but overall was unimpressed. The majority of their stock can be found at your local convenience store.
Great experience' however it can be a little busy at it is in bamnnf how ever there is a large selection of different candies and chocolate. Staff is incredibly nice and respectful. It's easy to find
